versions.label: Introduced
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 MD S 361
Author: Hester
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 01/17/2025

SENATE BILL 361

By: Senator Hester

Introduced and read first time: January 17, 2025

Assigned to: Education, Energy, and the Environment

A BILL ENTITLED

AN ACT concerning

Election Law - Influence on a Voter's Voting Decision By Use of Fraud - Prohibition

FOR the purpose of prohibiting a person from using fraud to influence or attempt to influence a voter's voting decision; defining "fraud" to include the use of synthetic media; and generally relating to the use of fraud to influence a voter's voting decision.

BY repealing and reenacting, with amendments,

Article - Election Law

Section 16-201

Annotated Code of Maryland

(2022 Replacement Volume and 2024 Supplement)

SECTION 1. BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF MARYLAND, That the Laws of Maryland read as follows:

Article - Election Law

16-201.

(a) (1) In this section, "influence" THE FOLLOWING WORDS HAVE THE MEANINGS INDICATED.

(2) "FRAUD" INCLUDES THE USE OF SYNTHETIC MEDIA.

(3) "INFLUENCE" includes the use of pressure, deception, trickery, or direct or indirect authority to induce action or to change the decision or act of another, regardless of the medium used.

(4) "SYNTHETIC MEDIA" MEANS AN IMAGE, AN AUDIO RECORDING, OR A VIDEO RECORDING THAT HAS BEEN INTENTIONALLY CREATED OR MANIPULATED WITH THE USE OF GENERATIVE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OR OTHER DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY TO CREATE A REALISTIC BUT FALSE IMAGE, AUDIO RECORDING, OR VIDEO RECORDING:

(I) PURPORTING TO DEPICT A REAL, CLEARLY IDENTIFIED CANDIDATE OR THE SPEECH OR CONDUCT OF THE CANDIDATE; OR

(II) PRODUCING A FUNDAMENTALLY DIFFERENT UNDERSTANDING OR IMPRESSION OF AN INDIVIDUAL'S APPEARANCE, SPEECH, OR CONDUCT THAN A REASONABLE INDIVIDUAL WOULD HAVE FROM THE UNALTERED, ORIGINAL VERSION OF THE IMAGE, AUDIO RECORDING, OR VIDEO RECORDING.

(b) A person may not willfully and knowingly:

(1) (i) impersonate another person in order to vote or attempt to vote; or

(ii) vote or attempt to vote under a false name;

(2) vote more than once for a candidate for the same office or for the same ballot question;

(3) vote or attempt to vote more than once in the same election, or vote in more than one election district or precinct;

(4) vote in an election district or precinct without the legal authority to vote in that election district or precinct;

(5) influence or attempt to influence a voter's voting decision through the use of force, FRAUD, threat, menace, intimidation, bribery, reward, or offer of reward;

(6) influence or attempt to influence a voter's decision, through the use of force, fraud, threat, menace, intimidation, bribery, reward, or offer of reward, whether to:

(i) go to the polls to cast a vote; or

(ii) vote by other lawful means; or

(7) engage in conduct that results or has the intent to result in the denial or abridgement of the right of any citizen of the United States to vote on account of race, color, or disability.

(c) Except as provided in § 16-1002 of this title, a person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine of not more than $5,000 or imprisonment for not more than 5 years or both.

(d) A person who violates this section is subject to § 5-106(b) of the Courts Article.

SECTION 2. AND BE IT FURTHER ENACTED, That this Act shall take effect June 1, 2025.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

FOR the purpose of prohibiting a person from using fraud to influence or

Section 16-201

(2022 Replacement Volume and 2024 Supplement)

SECTION 1. BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF MARYLAND, That the Laws of

**Article - Election Law**

16-201.

(a) _(1)_ In this section~~, "influence"~~ _THE FOLLOWING WORDS HAVE THE

_(2) "FRAUD" INCLUDES THE USE OF SYNTHETIC MEDIA._

_(3) "INFLUENCE"_ includes the use of pressure, deception, trickery, or direct

another, regardless of the medium used.

_(4) "SYNTHETIC MEDIA" MEANS AN IMAGE, AN AUDIO RECORDING, OR A VIDEO
RECORDING THAT HAS BEEN INTENTIONALLY CREATED OR MANIPULATED WITH THE USE OF
GENERATIVE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OR OTHER DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY TO CREATE A
REALISTIC BUT FALSE IMAGE, AUDIO RECORDING, OR VIDEO RECORDING:_

_(I) PURPORTING TO DEPICT A REAL, CLEARLY IDENTIFIED CANDIDATE OR THE SPEECH

(b) A person may not willfully and knowingly:

(1) (i) impersonate another person in order to vote or attempt to vote; or

(ii) vote or attempt to vote under a false name;

(2) vote more than once for a candidate for the same office or for the same
ballot question;

(3) vote or attempt to vote more than once in the same election, or vote in

(4) vote in an election district or precinct without the legal authority to

(5) influence or attempt to influence a voter's voting decision through the

of reward;

(6) influence or attempt to influence a voter's decision, through the use of
force, fraud, threat, menace, intimidation, bribery, reward, or offer of
reward, whether to:

(i) go to the polls to cast a vote; or

(ii) vote by other lawful means; or

(7) engage in conduct that results or has the intent to result in the denial
or abridgement of the right of any citizen of the United States to vote on
account of race, color, or disability.

(c) Except as provided in ยง 16-1002 of this title, a person who violates this
section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine of
not more than $5,000 or imprisonment for not more than 5 years or both.

(d) A person who violates this section is subject to ยง 5-106(b) of the Courts
Article.

SECTION 2. AND BE IT FURTHER ENACTED, That this Act shall take effect June 1,
2025.

CHAPTER ______

AN ACT concerning

Election Law - Influence on a Voter's Voting Decision By Use of Fraud - Prohibition

FOR the purpose of prohibiting a person from using fraud to influence or attempt to influence a voter's voting decision; defining "fraud" to include the use of synthetic media; and generally relating to the use of fraud to influence a voter's voting decision.

BY repealing and reenacting, with amendments,

Article - Election Law

Section 16-201

Annotated Code of Maryland

(2022 Replacement Volume and 2024 Supplement)

SECTION 1. BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF MARYLAND, That the Laws of Maryland read as follows:

Article - Election Law

16-201.

(a) (1) In this section, "influence" THE FOLLOWING WORDS HAVE THE MEANINGS INDICATED.

(2) "FRAUD" INCLUDES THE USE OF SYNTHETIC MEDIA.

(3) "INFLUENCE" includes the use of pressure, deception, trickery, or direct or indirect authority to induce action or to change the decision or act of another, regardless of the medium used.

(4) "SYNTHETIC MEDIA" MEANS AN IMAGE, AN AUDIO RECORDING, OR A VIDEO RECORDING THAT HAS BEEN INTENTIONALLY CREATED OR MANIPULATED WITH THE USE OF GENERATIVE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OR OTHER DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY TO CREATE A REALISTIC BUT FALSE IMAGE, AUDIO RECORDING, OR VIDEO RECORDING:

(I) PURPORTING TO DEPICT A REAL, CLEARLY IDENTIFIED CANDIDATE OR THE SPEECH OR CONDUCT OF THE CANDIDATE; OR

(II) PRODUCING A FUNDAMENTALLY DIFFERENT UNDERSTANDING OR IMPRESSION OF AN INDIVIDUAL'S APPEARANCE, SPEECH, OR CONDUCT THAN A REASONABLE INDIVIDUAL WOULD HAVE FROM THE UNALTERED, ORIGINAL VERSION OF THE IMAGE, AUDIO RECORDING, OR VIDEO RECORDING.

(b) A person may not willfully and knowingly:

(1) (i) impersonate another person in order to vote or attempt to vote; or

(ii) vote or attempt to vote under a false name;

(2) vote more than once for a candidate for the same office or for the same ballot question;

(3) vote or attempt to vote more than once in the same election, or vote in more than one election district or precinct;

(4) vote in an election district or precinct without the legal authority to vote in that election district or precinct;

(5) influence or attempt to influence a voter's voting decision through the use of force, FRAUD, threat, menace, intimidation, bribery, reward, or offer of reward;

(6) influence or attempt to influence a voter's decision, through the use of force, fraud, threat, menace, intimidation, bribery, reward, or offer of reward, whether to:

(i) go to the polls to cast a vote; or

(ii) vote by other lawful means; or

(7) engage in conduct that results or has the intent to result in the denial or abridgement of the right of any citizen of the United States to vote on account of race, color, or disability.

(c) Except as provided in § 16-1002 of this title, a person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine of not more than $5,000 or imprisonment for not more than 5 years or both.

(d) A person who violates this section is subject to § 5-106(b) of the Courts Article.

SECTION 2. AND BE IT FURTHER ENACTED, That this Act shall take effect June 1, 2025.
